content.question: public class Time { private int hours; private int minutes; public Time(int h, int m) { hours = h; minutes = m; } /** Returns true if hours * 60 + minutes of this * object is equal to hours * 60 + minutes of object * other; otherwise returns false */ public boolean equals(Object other) { //implementation not shown } } The following code segment appears in a class other than Time. Time t1 = new Time(1, 10); Time t2 = new Time(0, 70); Which of the following statements will print true ? System.out.println(t1 == t2); System.out.println(t1.equals(t2)); System.out.println(equals(t1, t2);

skill.text: 2.B: Write program code involving data abstractions.
